intro: Sisymbriopsis schugnana, commonly known as the narrowleaf tansy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and has small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and serrated, and it is often found in dry, sandy soils. Sisymbriopsis schugnana is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
